Instrument.name: LUNAR DUST EXPERIMENT
Instrument.description: The Lunar Dust Experiment is an in situ instrument designed to characterize the dust exosphere by mapping the size and spatial distributions of dust grains in the lunar environment as a function of local time and the position of the Moon with respect to the magnetosphere of the Earth.
